lead_paragraph: A combination of stigma and ignorance, a “family values” emphasis and government indifference have pushed H.I.V. to epidemic status.

byline.contributor: Oleg Matsnev contributed reporting from St. Petersburg, and Sophia Kishkovsky from Moscow.

headline.print_headline: Russia’s Government Does Little as H.I.V. Cases Surpass a Million
headline.main: H.I.V. Cases Surpass a Million in Russia, but Little Is Done

snippet: A combination of stigma and ignorance, a “family values” emphasis and government indifference have pushed H.I.V. to epidemic status....
abstract: Number of Russians who have received positive HIV diagnosis has passed 1 million mark in 2016, but government has given little indication that it plans to take steps to address crisis; HIV-positive people in Russia face stigma similar to that in 1980s West, while strife between Kremlin and nongovernmental organizations stymies action.
